item.title: Just tried Meet Hour â€“ surprisingly solid Zoom/Google Meet alternative (+ 10% off code!)
item.description:
Hey folks,
I recently gave **Meet Hour** a shot for video conferencing, and honestly? Itâ€™s kinda underrated. Itâ€™s got a clean UI, smart features, and feels like a nice blend of Zoom, Google Meet, and even a bit of Calendly all in one.
Hereâ€™s what I liked about it:
âœ… **No Downloads** â€“ 100% browser-based. Just click the link and go. âœ… **Secure** â€“ End-to-end encrypted for private convos. âœ… **Custom Branding** â€“ Add your own logo, colors, etc. to the meeting room. Super clutch for businesses and coaches. âœ… **Built-in Scheduling** â€“ No need for extra tools â€“ you can schedule, send invites, and set reminders. âœ… **Live Streaming & Recording** â€“ Go live on YouTube/Facebook or record meetings with one click. âœ… **Interactive Features** â€“ Whiteboard, polls, Q&A, hand raising â€“ everything for engagement. âœ… **Handles Large Groups** â€“ Works well for webinars, events, and big teams. âœ… **Affordable Plans + Free Tier** â€“ Thereâ€™s a free version, but the paid ones are really budget-friendly too.
ğŸ”¹ **And right now theyâ€™re offering 10% off all plans** with this promo code: **MHAFDIYEmehchx5a**
I used it for a few client sessions and team calls, and the experience was super smooth. Might actually switch over full-time.
Anyone else using Meet Hour? Would love to hear your thoughts!
